items.name: Loitokitok Shrine Forest
items.short_description: This ancient acacia woodland is revered by the Maasai as a sacred space for ancestral spirits, used for prayer, traditional ceremonies, and blessings. It's a place of deep spiritual tranquility.
items.address: Southeast sector, near Loitokitok Gate, Amboseli National Park

items.name: Ol Donyo Orok's Whisper
items.short_description: A revered rock formation where Maasai laibons (spiritual leaders) once sought prophetic visions and guidance from ancestral voices carried on the winds. It is believed to be a conduit to ancient wisdom.
items.address: Foot of Ol Donyo Orok mountain, Amboseli National Park

items.name: Kitirua Rhino Cave
items.short_description: This hidden cave, believed to be a former refuge for rhinos, now serves as a quiet sanctuary for introspection and connects visitors to the ancient spirit of the land. Its secluded nature fosters deep contemplation.
items.address: Western boundary, near Kitirua Conservancy, Amboseli National Park

items.name: Embenek e Siria (The Standing Stones of Sirius)
items.short_description: A unique cluster of weathered monoliths aligned with celestial bodies, believed to be an ancient Maasai astronomical observatory and site for star-gazing rituals. It signifies a profound connection between earth and sky.
items.address: Central plains, 5km east of Amboseli Airstrip
